column4: Hi guys, I'm forced to install an rpm-based framework on ubuntu, I had to install many package but I still get errors, please look at this installation-failure log... http://pastie.org/245070
used alien ?
no...
as rpm isn't supported in ubu, use alien to convert it to a deb-pckage
can't you get the tarball ?
gonna see, it isn't a simple package, is the "ltib", a development environment...
It has been tested on debian 3 and marked as unstable...
BU
But it can get installed at least, I think...
tarball is the better way, as alien sometimes files
you mean recompile it from source ?
tarball=recompile is the better way, as alien sometimes fails
ok, thanks !
guido:but in debian no deb-package ???
ï»¿kushal1: lspci
I have to correct myself... The framework is actually installed, the log comes out when i RUN the program ltib (with the --configure option or not)...
I need some help to understand the error... http://pastie.org/245070
guido:see, paste the /home/guido/ltib/ltib-imx21ads-20070221/host_config.log
guido:(cli) sudo update db
the file you have seen is just the host_config.log
i've downloaded the tarball and run an istalling script inside it, and now it seems to work... Thanks !
